result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Cornell L Williamson

ADDRESS INFO for Cornell L Williamson

Prior: Homeless, Homeless, WI

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:49 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM599 AND 15CM600. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM599: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
In 15CM600: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM599: Amended Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Jackan makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 20 days MCJ with 20 days credit and payment fo court costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
Adj: 2:56 pm

INCLUDES 15CM599, 15CM600.  No contact with victim(s): Riiser Store - Stewart Ave., Kwik Trip - Hwy 51.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
